8. The REINS Act has passed the House of Representatives on multiple occasions, but has never received an up-or-down vote in the Senate. That must change‚Äîsoon.

(7) Those opposing the REINS Act complain that it would deprive the American people of the expertise of each federal agency. This is untrue; it would simply prohibit these regulations from taking effect automatically, without an act of Congress (subject to presidential veto).

(6) A bill called the REINS Act would require that new ‚Äúmajor rule‚Äù regulations may take effect only after Congress enacted legislation to that effect. Each regulation would be considered on a fast-track procedure, requiring a prompt, up-or-down vote in both houses of Congress.

(5) Whenever such an agency unwisely imposes unfair burdens on the public, members of Congress‚Äîincluding those who voted to give that agency sweeping rule-making power in the first place‚Äîcomplain vociferously, often ignoring Congress‚Äôs role in the process altogether.

(4) Using this approach, Congress passes laws granting broad ‚Äúrule-making‚Äù power‚Äîusing unobjectionable-sounding language‚Äîto a specific federal agency. E.g., ‚Äúwe shall have clean air, and EPA is hereby authorized to adopt legally binding regulations to make the air cleaner.‚Äù

11. If everything anyone dislikes is fascism, then nothing is. If everyone decided to use ‚Äúfascism‚Äù interchangeably with ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt like that‚Äù or ‚Äúthat‚Äôs unfair,‚Äù it would become far more difficult to identify actual fascism where it makes an appearance. That‚Äôs dangerous.

9. Where has DeSantis ever attempted to exalt federal power at the expense of state and local authority?
8. Where has DeSantis ever tried to exalt collective, national interests at the expense of individual rights?

7. Where has DeSantis ever advocated for centralized government power? Where has he ever sought government control of the economy or any institution of civil society? Where has he ever supported policies that treat people differently on the basis of race?

6. The Cambridge Dictionary defines ‚Äúfascism‚Äù as a ‚Äúpolitical system based on a very powerful leader, state control of social and economic life, and extreme pride in country and race, with no expression of political disagreement.‚Äù

5. Merriam-Webster says ‚Äúfascism‚Äù is a philosophy ‚Äúthat exalts nation and often race above the individual and that stands for a centralized autocratic government headed by a dictatorial leader, severe economic and social regimentation, and forcible suppression of opposition.‚Äù
